ualberta.g12.adventurecreator.data

Class Story

  • java.lang.Object
    • ualberta.g12.adventurecreator.data.SModel
      • ualberta.g12.adventurecreator.data.Story
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Story
extends SModel
implements java.io.Serializable
    Models a story that would be created by an Author. Contains a list of Fragments as well as an author and a title.

    A stories id must be unique when publishing it online. When publishing a story, if there already a story with an identical ID that story will be overwritten by the newly published story.
    A story's id is made up of the hashcode of the storyTitle appended with its author. Whenever a story's title or author is changed, its id is updated appropriately.
    If a story has a null author or title, it will be assigned the ID of Story.INVALID_ID and it will be impossible to upload this story through normal means. The design pattern Null Object was used in this class. As can be seen when an object of this class is instantiated all fields are initialized to non-null values.

    See Also:
    Fragment, Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int INVALID_ID
      Signifies that a story with this id is invalid, usually meaning that either its Title or Author is null.
      If a story has this id then it will not be publishable.

      • INVALID_ID

        public static final int INVALID_ID
        Signifies that a story with this id is invalid, usually meaning that either its Title or Author is null.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Story

        public Story()
        Create an Empty Story. This story will have the default start Fragment: "Story Start Fragment" and a title and author of a blank string.

      • Story

        public Story(java.lang.String title,
     java.lang.String author)
        Create an Empty Story. This story will have the default start Fragment "Story Start Fragment" and the title and author defined.
        Parameters:
        title - the title of the new Story
        author - the author of the new Story

      • getStartFragPos

        public int getStartFragPos()

        Returns:

      • getFragments

        public java.util.List<Fragment> getFragments()
        The list of Fragment contains all of the Fragments in the Story. Fragments are used for storying sections of the story. These section can be thought of as chapters.
        Returns:
        fragment The list of Fragments for the Story.
        See Also:
        Fragment

      • setFragments

        public void setFragments(java.util.List<Fragment> fragments)
        sets the Fragment list for a Story. The list of Fragment contains all of the Fragments in the Story. Fragments are used for storying sections of the story. These section can be thought of as chapters.
        See Also:
        Fragment

      • getId

        public int getId()
        will get id of the story (should be unique). Users are not allowed to set ids, it is done automatically by the system.
